critique: The document is an executive order withdrawing land in Alaska for military purposes. The primary emotion the President wants to elicit is a sense of security and confidence in the government's ability to protect the nation. The tone is formal and authoritative, which contributes to this feeling. There is no explicit mention of emotions, so I will have to infer them from the context and language. Joy is unlikely, as the document is serious and practical. Sadness is also unlikely, as the document is about strengthening national defense. Anger is possible, as some people may be upset about the land being taken. Fear is possible, as the document implies a need for military preparedness. Disgust is unlikely. Surprise is possible, as the order may be unexpected. I will revise the scores to reflect these considerations.
